required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Remote Care for CIED Patients in Korea
clinical_study.official_title: Quality and Satisfaction in CIED Remote Monitoring

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is for monitoring the quality and satisfaction of CIED patients who are naive with remote device monitoring.

primary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction measurement before and after remote monitoring
primary_outcome.description: Satisfaction measurement by questionnaire: Survey on telehealth patient experience(modified Korean version by YouMi Hwang,2020 from Bas-Villalobos, Form I) and Post remote monitoring satisfaction questionnaire, modified Korean version by YouMi Hwang,2020 from HoMASQ (Home Monitoring Acceptance and Satisfaction Questionnaire, Form II): Usually higher scores mean a worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Any changes in prescription or patient visit schedule
secondary_outcome.description: Any changes in prescription or patient visit schedule based on remote monitoring

secondary_outcome.measure: Out patient clinic time consumption per patient
secondary_outcome.description: Out patient clinic time consumption per patient
Changes in CIED parameters during remote monitoring

secondary_outcome.measure: Admission for heart failure or any cardiovascular intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Admission for heart failure or any cardiovascular intervention

intervention.description: CIED monitoiring with remote monitoring device

study_pop.textblock: This study includes Biotronic CIED implanted patients in St. Vincent's Hospital, Catholic University of Korea, Republic of Korea. Study population are included if they are more than 20year old, followed up at outpatient clinic > 6 months after CIED implantation, and are literate and have perceptibility on questionnaire.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with Biotronic CIED implanted in St. Vincent's Hospital, Catholic University of Korea, Republic of Korea
2. Patients who are literate and have perceptibility on questionnaire
3. Patients who followed up more than 6 months after CIED implantation
4. Patients with age of >20 years
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with < 2 outpatient clinic visits during >6 months
2. Illiterate patients or inapprehensive of questionnaire
3. Patients with life expectancy of <1 year

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor in Internal Medicine, Cardiology, Cardiac Electrophysiologist
